alert.note: Alert for Cerro Gordo; Floyd; Worth (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 5:13PM CST until March 01 at 6:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Winnebago River at Mason City affecting Floyd, Worth and Cerro Gordo Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winnebago River at Mason City. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, There is widespread flooding of city parks and water reaches the underside of the 12th Street Northeast bridge at the piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 10.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river has reached flood stage and will continue to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet early tomorrow. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 04/28/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
